Off to Wigtown tomorrow! Excited for a little holiday even though I will mostly be working on my thesis. Can't wait for all the bookshops, and for the poor dog to have some respite from the relentless festival fireworks hellscape 👏📚💛

There’s a great wee exhibition currently on @natlibscot on women in #WW1, put together by young people in Scotland through the Youngwummin project. It combines museum/library objects & new work. Those dress designs are 👌 https://t.co/VqCDbSp0ld

This year’s @craftscotland Summer Show at White Stuff (George Street) is a a delight - filled with incredible Scottish made jewellery, knitwear, ceramics & accessories. Feeling v. good about my earring purchase 💛🌞💛 https://t.co/nhzeoWRtwU
RT @simonianbrown: Working with Byron's sock today! Worn when he was a child, 1790-1800 ish. @Newstead_Abbey https://t.co/zd9ndcmL3E

@Freya_Gowrley You're welcome! Just did my bibliography so it's all fresh in my mind. Also, welcome back and let's get coffee soon!!
@Freya_Gowrley Also really enjoyed Sarah de Nardi's paper “An embodied approach to Second World War storytelling mementoes.”

@Freya_Gowrley I assume you've read the Emotional Textiles special issue but just in case you haven't read the whole thing I love @FourRedShoes's paper “Grave Emotions: Textiles and Clothing from Nineteenth-Century London Cemeteries"!
For the CFP and more info how a Twitter conference works see our website: https://t.co/81HF7SHEv3 Please do RT, we'd love to reach a wide and varied audience! #CFP #WTOStc https://t.co/0Ge2VtrHlj
@AnnaFeintuck @olivialanguage I can definitely lend you something! Will have a look when I get home 📚📚📚

@rebeccatravel1 @stuffofwar @TheUPMuseum (Slightly different time periods of course, but I imagine they shared some similar experiences)

@rebeccatravel1 @stuffofwar @TheUPMuseum These are fascinating - thanks for sharing! My Great-Grandparents were stationed in India too and my Grandad was born there in 1924 - he went back to visit a couple of years ago!
Really excited to see what comes from this fantastic project, and to be contributing something small to it myself! #ww1 #fww @stuffofwar https://t.co/oXZ5WMh7tP

@DandyandRose1 Oh no! Sometimes it is better not knowing so we can hold on to those cool family myths.
I obviously succumbed and started a family tree. Discovered my Great-Uncle was interned as enemy alien for a week in 1941, despite having been exempted in 39. More digging required.

Perfect break from thesis seeing Mamma Mia this evening with @AnnaFeintuck & @laurasharrison. My new aim in life is to own *those* yellow trousers worn by Lily James. Also made me consider graduation outfit options? https://t.co/2U7t0llA22
@cgsloan So. Many. Wormholes. !!!

Got an ancestry website free trial to check some details of passenger lists referenced in my thesis, and now it is taking all my self control to focus on thesis edits and not tracing my entire family history .... #nerdproblems #PhDlife

I started my day with some nice news, a funding award from The Fran Trust to attend the @DressHistorians conference in London this October! Really looking forward to spending a whole day with other people as interested in #WW1 fashion as I am. (Image: IWM Q 79964) https://t.co/TMENmNjocV
@liztregenza Good luck!! Hope today goes well!

Just in case you've missed it, all kinds of things are afoot at @stuffofwar HQ! We have a Twitter conference AND social event coming up on September 28 - join us online or in person to share research or drink and chat with us! More here: https://t.co/81HF7SHEv3 Please RT!

@GregWiker @StCeciliasHall @DovecotStudios @EdinCulture Cloisters, Bennets, Blue Blazer & Bow Bar are all great proper pubs with good ale selections. Hanging Bat is more of a bar with a wild range of craft beers. The Southern, Red Squirrel & Holyrood 9A also have great beers & burgers. Canny Mans & Kays Bar have to been seen! Enjoy!

Thanks for sharing @lauravarnam - we'd really love to get more medievalists involved in WTOS!
A weekend bump for this - it's very easy to apply! Just send us a 100 word summary of your proposed paper, a 100 word bio, and your twitter handle. #WTOStc #WTOS https://t.co/gywtBq55xA
